Is it a shoulder or a butt

Hi David. The Pork Shoulder Butt is referring to a piece of meat on the upper shoulder of the hog that is close to the neck. The back end of the hog is called the ham. In colonial New England, butchers packed inexpensive cuts of meat into large barrels, called Butts, for storage and transportation. The pork shoulder meat packed into these barrels became known as Boston Butt (or Pork Butt), and the name stuck. Hope this helps! -Ernie

why?

Byron, let me explain from a Black man's perspective. What we wanted and as Rev Martin Luther King preached, was to be treated equally to others. Judge as by our character, our work, our work ethic. DEI, Affirmative action etc treats us as if we are LESS than others, and need special help to succeed. Kind of like we are the runt of the human species. Need to give us special attention. All I ever asked for is an even playing field. When someone sees my home, my diploma, etc I know their first thought is that I did not fully earn it. Brother Malcolm X warned us back fifty years ago: “The White liberal is the worst enemy to America and the worst enemy to the Black man.

Cuánto cuesta una membresía en Costco

Gladys- Tenemos dos tipos de membresías diferentes. La Membresía Dorada y la Membresía de Negocio. Ambas membresías cuestan $65 y te permiten comprar en todos los almacenes de Costco y en línea en http://Costco.com. Cualquiera de las membresías se pueden actualizar a una Membresía Ejecutiva por $130, la cual le ofrece una recompensa de 2% en sus compras (se aplican exclusiones) y también tiene ciertas ventajas y/o descuentos en muchos de nuestros servicios. Ambas membresías vienen con dos tarjetas, por lo cual puede compartir los beneficios de ser socio con alguien en su hogar de la edad de 16 años o mayor. ¡Gracias! -Gerry

Livonia- Our online inventory isn’t a duplicate of our warehouse product inventory, but rather an extension of it. There are items you’ll find online that you won’t find in the warehouse, and vice versa. When searching for warehouse inventory, you can use the Costco app, tap the warehouse tab, and then search for the item there. We hope this helps! -Bekah

I wish people would stop using acronyms and just say what they mean. They should say, "I'm against Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion." Why is there a need for Diversity? Because America is made up of a diverse population, not just White Men. Like Affirmative Action, the BIGGEST beneficiary of DEI are White WOMEN, followed by VETERANS, the disabled, then People of Color, and then people who are NOT Heterosexual and Transgender. Work places that foster Diversity have a happier and more productive workforce as well as a greater reach with their clientele. It's not merely meeting a quota. It's ensuring that in the hiring process, the workforce includes a balanced workplace composed of those who have been historically shut out. This is where the Equity part comes in.
Shoulder or butt which is it different ends of the animal

Tom- Great question! The Pork Shoulder Butt is referring to a piece of meat on the upper shoulder of the hog that is close to the neck. The back end of the hog is called the ham. In colonial New England, butchers packed inexpensive cuts of meat into large barrels, called Butts, for storage and transportation. The pork shoulder meat packed into these barrels became known as Boston Butt (or Pork Butt), and the name stuck. Hope this helps! -Christina
